item.title: Pokemon Bug Trainer Intervention
item.description: Even gym leaders need an intervention from their Pokemon sometimes.

item.title: Genshin Impact: How To Obtain The Dye (Legendary "Color" Quest)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Unlock the Legendary “Color” Quest In Genshin Impact
  • How To Break The Barrier And Head Inside
  • How To Obtain The Dye

Similar to every other tribe in Natlan, the Masters of the Night-Wind in Genshin Impact also have their own Reputation system. Since the Reputation system is a little different from the other nations of Teyvat, each tribe has three quests that fall under the Tribal Reputation Quest catalog.

Two of the three quests are usually unlocked the minute you unlock the region, and the same can be said about the Masters of the Night-Wind. Once Genshin Impact players unlock the Statue of the Seven, heading towards the tribal encampment will automatically trigger a cutscene. Travelers will meet a mysterious Iktomisaurus, and they’ll need to head further into the tribe for the quest to appear in the navigation.

How To Unlock the Legendary “Color” Quest In Genshin Impact

The Legendary “Color” quest is the second part in the Tribal Reputation quest series and can only be unlocked after completing the prerequisite Calling from the Masters of the Night-Wind . This quest is pretty simple and will be unlocked once you head through the gigantic front door in the center of the tribe and meet the mysterious Iktomisaurus. Simply follow the quest navigation to meet the Masters of the Night-Wind chief and help him sort out his problems.

Once you’re done there, he’ll guide you to meet Toltec, who will also be inside the Sacrificial Altar of Enigmatic Land . If you’re entering from outside, simply touch the scroll beside Amazolli to enter the area again and head behind you up the path to find Toltec.

How To Break The Barrier And Head Inside

You'll need to follow the quest navigation to reach the next area since the teleportation waypoint is below ground in a canyon of sorts. Toltec will require you to head inside, and there are a few spiderwebs that you’ll need to break to get through. Afterward, indwell the Iktomisaurus and head to the end of the cave. You need to use your elemental sight on the wall in front of you, and when the graffiti pops up, use the Iktomisaurus skill to remove the barrier.

How To Obtain The Dye

Head inside the cave towards the navigation point and let the story run through. You then need to use the Iktomisaurus Elemental Sight to find the dyes.

If the dyes do not show at first, go and extract the blue seelie to your left and the yellow seelie beside the water.

Head back to the glowing light, and then use the Elemental Sight again. The three dyes should pop up now.

  • The first blue dye will be where the blue seelie was.
  • The second pink dye will be directly across from it in some boxes.
  • And then, directly ahead, the third yellow dye will be available to collect.

Once you’re done, head out of the cave to meet Toltec, who will then tell you to go back to the Masters of the Night-Wind. Teleport to the Reputation Obsidian Totem Pole and speak to the Masters of the Night-Wind, Chief Biram , to hand over the dyes. You’ll then head into the Chamber of Weaving with Chief Biram and create a pattern on the fabric. Just follow through with the story navigation, and you’ll reach the end.

item.title: Towers Of Aghasba: How To Cook Food
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Cook Food In Towers Of Aghasba
    • How To Craft A Campfire In Towers Of Aghasba
    • How To Use Campfire In Towers Of Aghasba

Cooking is an important part of Dreamlit Inc’s Towers of Aghasba , as it allows you to raise your character’s health bar without having to rely on berries and wild fruits. Since finding berries can take time, having the right cooking tools in your inventory can make everything faster and easier.

Excitingly, there are many quick meals you can make while fighting off the Withered Razlith, the main antagonist of the game’s story. However, cooking isn’t available from the start; you’ll need to complete a few story quests to unlock it. Here's what you need to know about cooking food in Towers of Aghasba .

How To Cook Food In Towers Of Aghasba

To start cooking meals in Towers of Aghasba , you’ll need a Campfire , the recipe for which Patihoon (the village chef) gives you at the end of the ‘Food for the Soul’ quest. Here are the prerequisites for it:

  • Complete the ‘Shipwrecked Shimu’ quest.
  • Complete the ‘Establish Our First Village’ quest.
  • Begin the ‘Food for the Soul’ quest.

During the ‘Food for the Soul’ quest, Patihoon asks for three Lettuce in order to prepare a proper meal for the hungry Shimu, as they’ve been living on Wheat Stew since coming to Aghasba, and it’s time to provide them with a healthier diet. Since Lettuce doesn't grow in the wild, you'll need to farm it yourself. Simply hit the ‘Tab’ button, go to the Build section, and set up a farm. These are the resources you'll need to build a farm in the game:

  • 10 Wood (Wood can be gathered by cutting down trees across the island).
  • 3 Rope (Rope can be made using Fiber in the Craft section of the Inventory menu).
  • 3 Resin (Resin can be obtained by chopping Resin Fir)
  • 3 Common Seed (Common Seeds can be easily collected by harvesting bushes)

Once you're done constructing, plant Common Seeds in the Crop Plot, and wait about five minutes for Lettuce to grow. After you’ve harvested three Lettuce, give them to Patihoon. In return, he’ll reward you with the Campfire recipe , unlocking cooking, and ending the 'Food for the Soul' quest.

How To Craft A Campfire In Towers Of Aghasba

When you’ve got the Campfire recipe, head to the Craft section of your inventory to check the materials needed to make it. Here’s a quick recap of the items you’ll need to craft a Campfire In Towers of Aghasba :

  • 5 Wood (To get Wood from trees, it’s crucial that you have a Stone Hatchet. If you don’t have one yet, you can craft one by combining Stones, Sticks, and Fiber).
  • 3 Thatch (Thatch is a yellowish-brown fiber that you can grab by harvesting bushes around the land).
  • 2 Flint (Flint can be collected by breaking Stone Boulders (giant stones) located in different areas of Aghasba — you'll need a Stone Pickaxe to get some).

Once you have all the materials, open your inventory by pressing the ‘Tab’ button, go to the ‘Craft’ section, select ‘Campfire,’ and hit the ‘Craft’ button to make it. When it’s done, you can place the Campfire anywhere on the island and use it for cooking food.

The best part is that you can remove it by pressing the ‘Q’ button and put it back in your inventory by pressing ‘E.’ This way, you can take it out anywhere while finishing quests without having to gather items and craft it again.

How To Use Campfire In Towers Of Aghasba

To cook food in Towers of Aghasba , players will need to place the Campfire pit on the ground. Just press the ‘Tab’ button to open your inventory, select the ‘Campfire,’ and click the ‘Use’ icon at the bottom left of the screen. You can rotate the pit using the ‘E’ and ‘Q’ buttons to find the perfect spot, then left-click to settle it.

Once in position, interact with the Campfire by pressing the ‘E’ button, choose the meal you want to make, and hit the ‘Craft’ icon to cook it. At the start, you'll only have four cooking recipes in the Campfire menu, including:

Sausage

  • 3 Raw Meat (from creatures like Skirtau, Plumpet, Fuzzyfin).
  • 2 Salt (from Salt Deposits).

Players can easily hunt animals with the Wooden Bow. You’ll get this bow from Hoa after learning to observe creatures using the Shimuscope. If your Flint Arrows break or get lost, you can always craft more in the Craft section by combining Flint, Sticks, and Thatch.

Ham

  • 1 Tender Fillet (from ground creatures)
  • 2 Salt

Meat Skewer

  • 1 Mushroom Cap (from Temperature Ecosystems)
  • 1 Raw Meat

Nutritious Salad

  • 2 Berries (from Tropical regions)
  • 1 Root (from Trees and Shrubs)

After cooking a meal, it’ll show up in your inventory. To eat it, just return to your inventory, click on the food, and tap the ‘Use’ icon. You can also store your food in Storage Boxes, but you'll need a Construction Table to do that.

item.title: Overwatch 2 Teases Balance Changes for Upcoming 6v6 Tests
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Tank cooldowns are being increased for 6v6 tests in Overwatch 2 to rebalance gameplay.
  • Some heroes receive nerfs, while a couple of supports get buffs to adjust to the new 6v6 format.
  • The changes aim to reduce visual clutter, keep soft crowd control, and balance hero power levels.

Overwatch 2 recently teased some of the balance changes for the Season 14 6v6 tests, including cooldown adjustments, reversions to several hero reworks, and duration reductions for barriers and battlefield obstacles. These and more changes will be implemented in an effort to adapt Overwatch 2 to the 6v6 format when the first test begins on or around December 17.

6v6 has officially returned to Overwatch 2 in the form of Overwatch: Classic. However, this is only the beginning of a greater experiment with six-player teams, with two different 6v6 tests planned for Overwatch 2 Season 14. To facilitate these tests, certain heroes will undergo changes specifically in this game mode.

During a recent interview with Overwatch 2 content creator Spilo, lead gameplay designer Alec Dawson gave a few examples of these changes. Many tanks in Overwatch 2 are receiving nerfs in the form of higher cooldowns on their abilities, such as with Ramattra’s Void Barrier and Reinhardt’s Charge. Others receive reversions to Overwatch 2 changes – Zarya’s barriers are on separate cooldowns again, Reinhardt loses one Fire Strike charge and steering efficiency on Charge, and Roadhog’s rework has been completely reversed.

Confirmed Overwatch 2 6v6-Specific Balance Changes

  • Tank nerfs
    • Many cooldown increases, including:
      • Ramattra’s Void Barrier
      • Reinhardt’s Charge
      • Reinhardt’s Fire Strike (now has one charge)
      • Zarya’s bubbles are on separate cooldowns

    • Tank critical and crowd control reduction passives are removed, health decreased
    • Reinhardt can cancel his charge, but maneuverability has been reduced
    • Roadhog’s rework is reverted, losing Pig Pen and the Take a Breather resource meter, but getting back his alt fire

  • Support buffs
    • Zenyatta’s Orb of Discord no longer has a cooldown per target, and has an increased effect
    • Ana’s Sleep Dart and Biotic Grenade cooldowns are reduced

  • Blanket changes
    • Automatic healing kicks in after 7 seconds, instead of 5 (Support is 3.5 seconds)
    • Persistent obstacles like Lifeweaver’s Tree of Life and Mauga’s Cage Fight will have duration reductions

That said, some heroes – especially supports in Overwatch 2 – are receiving buffs instead to help them juggle larger teams. For example, Zenyatta’s Orb of Discord has a bigger effect and no longer has a cooldown per target, and Ana’s Sleep Dart and Biotic Grenade both have their cooldowns reduced.

These balance changes may sound familiar, as they make heroes play similarly to how they do in Overwatch: Classic. In general, the design philosophy of the 6v6 tests is to move power from the tanks, reduce visual clutter and complexity, but keep Overwatch 2 's "soft crowd control" approach. Obstacles like Lifeweaver’s Tree of Life and Mauga’s Cage Fight will have their durations reduced, tank passives will be removed, and the auto-healing factor will take two seconds longer to kick in. Not everything is being reverted to Overwatch 2 levels, however – Winston keeps his alt-fire, and Mei does not get her Endothermic Blaster's freeze back. It seems like the 6v6 tests will be an interesting intersection between Overwatch 1 and 2 design philosophies.

item.title: Dragon Quest 3 Remake: How To Get The Night Light
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Where To Get The Night Light In Dragon Quest 3 Remake
  • How To Use The Night Light In Dragon Quest 3 Remake

Dragon Quest 3 Remake spends the first few hours exploring the first two main continents of the game. After getting the Black Pepper, players will get their own ship, and the entire map will open up as you search for the various orbs scattered throughout the world.

While the orbs are your main focus, there are a lot of other unique places to visit, and even more unique items to find. One of which is the Night Light, which lets players change the world to night whenever they are in the overworld; Here's where to find it.

Where To Get The Night Light In Dragon Quest 3 Remake

The Night Light is found in the city Theddon, found south of Portoga after you get the ship. Leaving from Portoga, sail west until you reach the open ocean then begin sailing south until you reach the southernmost tip of the southern continent. As long as you are coming from the western side of the continent, you can disembark anywhere and walk towards the town.

The Night Light can only be obtained during the day, so if you get there during the night go and stay at the Inn in order to change the time of day. During the daytime, head to the blacksmith store and go behind the counter and up the stairs. On the second floor, you'll find a skeleton in a bed and a chest nearby, with the Night Light being in the chest.

Before you leave Theddon, check it out during the night and during the day, as its story is unique since all the inhabitants don't appear during the day.

How To Use The Night Light In Dragon Quest 3 Remake

The Night Light will be sent to the last slot of your item back where it's best left as it doesn't get any use for being in a character's inventory.

  • Use the Light during the day to make it nighttime.
  • The Light only makes nighttime and can't change nighttime to daytime .
  • The Light can only be used when in the overworld, not while in towns or dungeons.

There are many monsters that you can recruit for the Monster Arena that only appear during the night, along with additional unique enemies to farm for XP that only come out at night. If you want to change the time back to day, you'll need to rest overnight at an inn or wait a few minutes for the game to naturally cycle.
